description: This apple cinnamon quick bread tastes like fall in a loaf pan! It’s tender, moist, and full of apple taste.
ingredients: [{"name": "light or dark brown sugar", "units": "cup", "amount": "½"}, {"name": "ground cinnamon", "units": "teaspoon", "amount": "½"}, {"name": "all-purpose flour", "units": "cups", "amount": "2"}, {"name": "baking powder", "units": "teaspoon", "amount": "1 and ½"}, {"name": "baking soda", "units": "teaspoon", "amount": "½"}, {"name": "salt", "units": "teaspoon", "amount": "1"}, {"name": "ground cinnamon", "units": "teaspoon", "amount": "½"}, {"name": "nutmeg", "units": "teaspoon", "amount": "⅓"}, {"name": "ginger", "units": "teaspoon", "amount": "⅓"}, {"name": "granulated sugar", "units": "cup", "amount": "¾"}, {"name": "sour cream", "units": "cup", "amount": "⅔"}, {"name": "vegetable oil", "units": "cup", "amount": "½"}, {"name": "medium eggs", "units": null, "amount": "2"}, {"name": "pure vanilla extract", "units": "teaspoon", "amount": "2"}, {"name": "peeled & chopped apples", "units": "cups", "amount": "1 and ¾"}]
instructions: Adjust the oven rack to the lower third position and preheat the oven to 350°F (177°C). Spray an 8×4-inch loaf pan with nonstick spray or line with parchment paper. In a small mixing bowl, mix the brown sugar and cinnamon together. In a medium bowl, whisk the flour, baking powder, baking soda, salt, and spices together and set aside. In a large bowl, whisk the sugar and sour cream until smooth. Whisk in oil, then add eggs and vanilla extract. Pour the wet ingredients into the dry ingredients and whisk until combined. Pour and spread about one-third of the batter into the prepared loaf pan, then distribute half of the chopped apples and sprinkle with half of the cinnamon mixture. Repeat this layering process, then pour the last of the batter over the top and sprinkle with the reserved cinnamon mixture. Bake for 45-55 minutes, covering loosely with aluminum foil if browning too quickly. Let cool in the pan for about 45-60 minutes before slicing.
notes: Use firm, fresh apples with a good sweet-tart balance. Use room temperature ingredients for best results. Freeze cooled & baked loaf for up to 3 months.
